title: 'Should not act as per political expediency': SC slams TN guv for 'sitting over' bills
content: The Supreme Court has strongly criticized Tamil Nadu governor RN Ravi for withholding assent to Bills passed by the state assembly. The court declared that the governor's actions, including reserving 10 Bills for the President after they were already reconsidered, were illegal and unconstitutional. The court declared these Bills as passed.

title: Former India cricketer Kedar Jadhav launches his political career with BJP
content: Former Indian cricketer Kedar Jadhav is set to begin his political career by joining the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) at a ceremony in Mumbai. The 40-year-old, known for his contributions to Indian cricket, including a memorable century against England, will be welcomed by key BJP figures, marking a new chapter after retiring from all formats of cricket earlier this year.

title: Over 200 fall ill in Greater Noida society, water contamination suspected
content: Ajnara Homes Society in Greater Noida is grappling with a health crisis as over 200 residents have fallen ill with symptoms like stomach pain and diarrhoea, raising concerns about contaminated drinking water. Residents suspect negligence from local authorities and society maintenance led to the contamination of the groundwater supply.

title: How a rumour on Trump’s tariff policy sparked a 7-minute $2.5 trillion stock rally
content: US stock markets briefly surged, adding $2.5 trillion, on a rumor of a potential tariff delay by Trump, highlighting market sensitivity to trade policy. The rally quickly faded as the report proved false, leaving investors uncertain.

title: BookMyShow to Kunal Kamra: Not delisted your shows or you as an artist…
content: BookMyShow has responded to allegations of delisting comedian Kunal Kamra's shows, clarifying that it acts as a neutral ticketing platform. The company stated that decisions regarding show listings are made by organizers or venues, not BookMyShow itself. They emphasized their commitment to neutrality and compliance with Indian laws, facilitating ticket sales for diverse events.

title: Farmer leader Pappu Singh, his son and brother shot dead in Uttar Pradesh
content: In Fatehpur's Akhri village, a violent altercation over a tractor blocking a road led to the fatal shooting of Bhartiya Kisan Union leader Pappu Singh, his son Abhay, and brother Pinku. The dispute began when former village head Suresh Kumar requested the tractor's removal, escalating into gunfire involving Suresh's sons and associates.

title: Husband's family offers to adopt and raise child after Muskan found pregnant in jail
content: Muskan Rastogi, accused of murdering her husband Saurabh Rajput, is found pregnant in jail. Preliminary tests confirm the pregnancy. Saurabh's family states they will raise the child if it is biologically related to Saurabh. Muskan and her lover Sahil are in judicial custody for the murder. An ultrasound will determine the pregnancy's duration.

title: Vaniya Agrawal, who disrupted Microsoft’s event shares resignation email sent
content: Vaniya Agrawal, an Indian-American software engineer, resigned from Microsoft after protesting the company's alleged role in providing AI technology to Israel's military. She disrupted Microsoft's 50th-anniversary celebration, accusing the company of enabling violence in Gaza. Agrawal cited a $133 million contract with Israel's Ministry of Defense and urged employees to sign the "No Azure for Apartheid" petition before being dismissed.

title: Man bobbitises sister-in-law’s rapist, breaks aide’s leg in Bihar
content: In Aurangabad, a 35-year-old man was arrested for allegedly mutilating one man and injuring another, both accused of sexually assaulting his sister-in-law ten days prior. The brother-in-law lured the two men, Nitish Ravidas and Jeevit Ravidas, to his home under false pretenses before the violent confrontation.

title: Lured, drugged and assaulted: 19-year-old claims ‘rape’ by 23 in 7 days in Varanasi
content: In Varanasi, a 19-year-old woman has accused 23 men of gang rape over a week after leaving home on March 29. Her mother's complaint named 12 individuals, with six already arrested. The survivor, after initial reluctance, underwent a medical examination. She alleges drugging and sexual assault at various locations.

title: Cabs better than flights? Driver transforms taxi experience with luxury
content: Abdul Qadeer, a taxi driver in Delhi, has gained attention for providing exceptional taxi service. His vehicle offers free snacks, water, Wi-Fi, and other amenities, creating a comfortable and enjoyable journey for passengers. This thoughtful service, praised on social media, redefines customer care and highlights his commitment to passenger satisfaction without extra charges.

title: Byju Raveendran files FIR, says ‘I am not a flower, I am the fire that will…’
content: Byju Raveendran has filed a criminal complaint against Pankaj Srivastava, the former resolution professional, Glas Trust, and EY employees, alleging a conspiracy against BYJU'S. This action follows claims of EY's collaboration with Glas Trust during insolvency proceedings. Raveendran accuses them of prioritizing lenders' interests and concealing evidence of misconduct, escalating the ongoing financial dispute.

title: 2 held for Jalandhar grenade attack; cops find Lawrence Bishnoi, Babbar Khalsa link
content: Punjab Police have apprehended two individuals linked to the grenade attack on BJP leader Manoranjan Kalia's Jalandhar residence. The suspects allegedly used an e-rickshaw, which has been recovered, and are connected to a plot involving Zeeshan Akhtar, Pakistan-based Shehzad Bhatti, the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, and Babbar Khalsa International.

title: Hi-tech identity fraud: How UP-based gang tampered Aadhaar biometrics in 12 states
content: A hi-tech identity fraud racket, operating from Uttar Pradesh, has been busted for allegedly tampering with biometric data of over 1,500 Aadhaar cardholders across 12 states. Police arrested four individuals who exploited loopholes in the UIDAI system, running a network of agents who collected documents for illegal updates.

title: 'Modi will be PM again': Maha CM Fadnavis puts an end to successor reports
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis asserted that Narendra Modi will remain Prime Minister in 2029, dismissing succession speculations fueled by Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut's comments. Raut suggested RSS might choose Modi's successor after his meeting with Mohan Bhagwat, hinting at a potential retirement due to age. Fadnavis countered, emphasizing it's inappropriate to discuss succession while Modi is still serving.

title: Shreyas Iyer nominated for ICC Men’s Player of the Month
content: Shreyas Iyer is the sole Indian nominee for the ICC Men’s Player of the Month award for March 2025, recognized for his pivotal role in India's Champions Trophy victory. He amassed 172 runs at an average of 57.33, demonstrating composure under pressure. His crucial innings against New Zealand and Australia solidified his nomination.

title: Jaipur bomb blast case: All four accused sentenced to life imprisonment
content: A Jaipur court sentenced four individuals to life imprisonment on Tuesday for their involvement in the live bomb detection case linked to the devastating 2008 serial blasts. The convicted include Shahbaz Hussain, Sarwar Azmi, Mohammad Saif, and Saif-ur-Rehman.

title: Viral video of Travis Head refusing fan selfie sparks debate on privacy
content: A video shows Australian cricketer Travis Head declining a selfie request. The incident happened in Hyderabad during the IPL season. Fans followed Head in a supermarket. They expressed frustration at his refusal. The video went viral on social media. It ignited discussions about respecting athletes' personal space. Reactions are mixed, with some criticising fan behaviour.

title: Shocking! KKR drop Moeen for a bowler leaking 10+ runs per over
content: Kolkata Knight Riders' surprising decision to bench Moeen Ali for Spencer Johnson in their IPL 2025 match against Lucknow Super Giants has sparked debate. Despite Johnson's high economy rate and limited wickets, KKR captain Ajinkya Rahane chose to bowl first at Eden Gardens. Fans question the move as KKR aims to improve their standing, while LSG remains unchanged.

title: 'There is only one Shiv Sena': Uddhav vows to reclaim lost grounds in Konkan region
content: Uddhav Thackeray, Shiv Sena (UBT) chief, has pledged to regain lost ground in Maharashtra's Konkan region following recent electoral defeats. He asserted that his is the only true Shiv Sena and announced plans to tour Konkan to revitalize the party.

title: MP 'doctor' who caused death of 7 patients was drawing Rs 8 lakh monthly salary
content: N John Camm, posing as Dr. Narendra Vikramaditya Yadav, was arrested for allegedly causing seven patient deaths at Damoh's Mission Hospital. He performed 13 surgeries and examined 70 patients during his two-month tenure, earning a high salary. Investigations revealed his medical registration was invalid, and he lacked proper credentials, raising concerns about hospital hiring practices and oversight.

title: Watch: Renowned Portuguese flutist plays 'Vaishnav Jan To' for Murmu
content: President Droupadi Murmu's Portugal visit was marked by cultural appreciation and strengthened ties. Rão Kyao's performance of Mahatma Gandhi's favorite bhajan at a state banquet highlighted the cultural connection. Murmu received Lisbon's 'City Key of Honour' and emphasized India's goal to become a developed nation by 2047.

title: Sensex rallies over 1,100 points: Top 5 reasons
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in opening trade on Tuesday a day after the terrible stock market crash. While BSE Sensex went above 74,700, Nifty50 was above 22,600.

title: 'Don’t need to ask India to ... ': JP Morgan CEO amid Trump's tariff war
content: JP Morgan CEO Jamie Dimon suggests the US should foster trade and investment with nonaligned nations like India and Brazil instead of demanding alignment, especially as Trump's tariffs take effect. He advocates for deepening trade ties with allies such as Australia, Japan, and the UK, noting the US lacks agreements with key partners who have deals with China.

title: Tariff turmoil: Did Elon Musk ask Donald Trump to pull back?
content: Elon Musk reportedly appealed to Donald Trump to reverse the newly imposed tariffs, marking a significant disagreement between the two figures. Tesla is facing mounting pressure as the electric carmaker's sales have declined, with investors concerned about the broader implications of the tariffs. Economists warn of potential inflationary pressure and recession risks due to the tariffs.

title: 'Serious injustice': Rahul urges President to step in amid Bengal teachers job row
content: Rahul Gandhi has urged President Murmu to intervene in the West Bengal teacher recruitment controversy, following the cancellation of over 25,000 appointments due to irregularities. He highlighted the plight of fairly selected teachers facing dismissal and requested the President to ensure their continued employment. Mamata Banerjee criticized the court's decision, alleging a conspiracy against the state's education system.

title: Gujaratis step into space long shaped by Punjabis in Canadian politics
content: As Canada gears up for its 45th federal election, a notable shift is occurring within the Indian diaspora. While Punjabi-Canadians have long dominated South Asian political engagement, this election sees a surge of Gujarati-origin candidates entering the political arena.

title: 'If US wants to talk, it should show respect': China amid fresh tariff threat
content: China has asserted that the United States must demonstrate respect and equality if it genuinely seeks trade talks, following the imposition of tariffs by President Trump. China accuses the US of employing pressure and blackmail, vowing to retaliate against further tariff escalations to protect its interests.

title: MP cops walk a tightrope as 'Dr Death' John Camm boasts of 15k+ cardiac surgeries
content: Madhya Pradesh police arrested N John Camm, also known as Narendra Vikramaditya Yadav. He is accused of performing illegal surgeries. These surgeries allegedly led to patient deaths. Police are investigating his medical qualifications. They are verifying his claim of performing 15,000 cardiac operations. Authorities are checking his MBBS degree and past work at hospitals.

title: 3 dead, 7 injured as 'drunk' driver goes on rampage in Jaipur
content: A speeding SUV claimed three lives and injured seven others in Jaipur's Nahargarh area on Monday night. The vehicle rammed into pedestrians and other vehicles, causing chaos. Among the deceased are Avdesh Pareek and Mamta. Locals apprehended the driver and handed him over to the police.

title: '3 J&K outfits disassociate from Hurriyat', announces Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced that three more political groups, including the Jammu Kashmir Islamic Political Party, have cut ties with the separatist Hurriyat Conference. Shah highlighted this as a sign of growing trust in the Indian Constitution within the valley. He noted that eleven organizations have now abandoned separatism, reinforcing the vision of a united and powerful India.

title: Hardik gets emotional after MI's 4th loss, brother Krunal consoles
content: Mumbai Indians faced their fourth defeat in five IPL 2025 matches against RCB, leaving captain Hardik Pandya emotional. RCB secured their first win at Wankhede in a decade, with Krunal Pandya consoling his brother after the close 12-run loss. Hardik had a good day with both bat and ball but didn't get enough support from his teammates.

title: 2013 Dilsukhnagar blasts case: Telangana HC upholds death penalty for 5 convicts
content: The Telangana High Court has confirmed the death penalty for five Indian Mujahideen operatives involved in the 2013 Dilsukhnagar blasts. The court dismissed their appeal against the sentence, holding them accountable for the twin bombings that killed 18 and injured over 100. A special NIA court in Hyderabad originally issued the death sentences in 2016.

title: 'Ignorant, impolite': China slams US VP JD Vance over 'peasants' remark
content: China has strongly criticised US Vice President JD Vance, labelling his remarks as "ignorant and impolite." This response follows Vance's controversial statement about the United States borrowing money from "Chinese peasants." The Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson expressed surprise and sadness at Vance's words, highlighting the ongoing tensions in China-US economic relations amidst trade disputes and tariff concerns.

title: After purported leaked chats, BJP shares video of 'spat' between TMC MPs
content: BJP IT cell chief Amit Malviya shared a video showing a heated argument between TMC MPs Kalyan Banerjee and Kirti Azad at the Election Commission headquarters. The dispute reportedly stemmed from disagreements over submitting a party memorandum, escalating to the point where police intervention was needed.

title: MasterChef India's Gujjuben aka Urmila Asher passes away at 79
content: Urmila Jamnadas Asher, fondly known as Gujjuben or Baa from MasterChef India, passed away at 79. She inspired many by participating in the show at 75 and showcasing her authentic cuisine. Her journey to support her grandson led her to Forbes 50 after 50, leaving behind a legacy of courage and joy that touched countless lives.

title: Israel flag in Ram Navami: How Kolkata marches use other nations’ colours
content: A political controversy erupted in Bengal after an Israeli flag was waved at a Ram Navami rally led by ex-BJP MP Arjun Singh. This event marks a shift from Kolkata's traditional political symbolism, where foreign flags like those of the USSR and Palestine were historically displayed during protests.

title: Joke row: Bombay HC grants relief to Kunal Kamra till April 16
content: The Bombay High Court has addressed a plea from comedian Kunal Kamra, issuing notices to Mumbai Police and Shiv Sena MLA Murji Patel regarding an FIR against Kamra. The FIR stems from allegations that Kamra called Deputy CM Eknath Shinde a "traitor" during a performance.

title: Karan Oberoi rape case: Mumbai court upholds legal proceedings against Pooja Bedi
content: A Mumbai sessions court has refused to halt legal proceedings against Pooja Bedi and seven others in connection to the 2019 Karan Oberoi rape case. The group is accused of revealing the rape survivor's identity during a press conference held at Bedi's residence.

title: BJP leader, others booked for altering Shobha Yatra route in Aligarh
content: Shakuntala Bharti leads procession through sensitive areas, sparking scuffle; accused booked for violating police guidelines on route change

title: Rupee sinks 50 paise to settle at 86.26 against U.S. dollar
content: At the interbank foreign exchange, the rupee opened at 85.89 and swung between a high of 85.82 and a low of 86.29 against the greenback. The unit ended at 86.26 (provisional), registering a loss of 50 paise from its previous closing level

title: Bengal school appointments row: Rahul Gandhi urges President Murmu to ensure those selected fairly get to keep job
content: ‘Treating teachers selected through fair means on par with tainted teachers is a serious injustice,’ he said and pointed out that most ‘untainted’ teachers have served for nearly a decade

title: Tribal hamlet in Coimbatore to get road connectivity at ₹1.62 crore: Minister
content: The Minister was responding to AIADMK MLA A.K. Selvaraj, who moved a calling attention motion seeking road connectivity to the hamlet, where 24 tribal families reside in the forest area

title: Jammu and Kashmir’s MLAs seek discussion on Waqf Act in Assembly
content: Jammu and Kashmir House adjourned amid uproar over disallowed discussion on Waqf (Amendment) Act, sparking protests from members

title: Uttar Pradesh cabinet approves hike in daily allowance for PRD personnel
content: Finance Minister Suresh Kumar Khanna said that the current daily allowance of ₹395 per personnel would be increased by ₹105, taking it to Rs 500 per day per person

title: II PU results: Indu PU College in Kootur bags first rank in Arts for 10th consecutive year in Karnataka
content: Vagishayya, Principal of Kottur’s Indu College, told The Hindu that nothing but hard work was behind the extraordinary feat

title: Mallikarjun Kharge slams BJP for appropriating Patel’s legacy, recalls he banned RSS
content: There was almost daily correspondence between the two. Nehruji used to take his advice on all matters. Nehruji had immense respect for Patel sahab, says Mallikarjun Kharge

title: NIA searches multiple locations linked to BKI ‘terrorist’ Goldy Brar in Haryana and Uttar Pradesh
content: The case is related to the December 2024 grenade attacks at Warehouse Club and Human Club at Sector-29 in Haryana’s Gurugram

title: Dhinakaran, Panneerselvam demand rollback in price of LPG cylinder, petrol, diesel
content: The AMMK leader said the hike had been made at a time when people were already reeling under the increase in prices of essential commodities

title: Police register FIR on 900 Kia engines ‘missing’ from Penukonda plant
content: According to a preliminary inquiry the theft is suspected to have occurred during the transportation of the engines from Chennai to Penukonda

title: Dharmapuri elephant death: CB-CID will thoroughly probe suspicious death of suspected poacher, says T.N. Forest Minister Ponmudy
content: The Minister was responding to a calling attention motion moved by PMK floor leader G.K. Mani and CPI floor leader T. Ramachandran into the death G. Senthil Kumar, a suspected poacher

title: Punjab Blast Accused Arrested, Cops Find A Lawrence Bishnoi Link
content: The grenade attack at BJP leader Manoranjan Kalia's home in Punjab's Jalandhar was masterminded by Zeeshan Akhtar, a close associate of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi and a wanted accused in the murder case of NCP leader Baba Siddiqui, sources said

title: "Shame... Embarrassment": Trinamool MP After BJP Leaks "Versatile Lady" Chats
content: The BJP has posted private WhatsApp chats between two Trinamool MPs - Kalyan Banerjee and Kirti Azad - that seem to show them squabbling over internal rows and referring to the "beautiful activities of (a) versatile international lady".

title: "Non-Aligned Nations Like India...": JPMorgan CEO's Advice To Donald Trump
content: Jamie Dimon, chief executive officer at JPMorgan Chase & Co, has warned that the recent tariff measures announced by US President Donald Trump may spark inflation and lead to recession in the world's biggest economy.

title: US Is Quietly Revoking Student Visas From Harvard To Stanford
content: US immigration authorities have revoked a spate of student visas for foreign nationals at major colleges including Harvard, Tufts and Stanford.

title: "Allah Kept Me Alive For A Reason, I'm Coming": Sheikh Hasina To Supporters
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has said, "Allah kept me alive for a reason", and the "day will come" when those targeting Awami League members will be brought to justice

title: Meerut Murder Accused Pregnant. What Dead Man's Brother Said
content: A day after Muskan Rastogi, who along with her lover is accused of killing her husband, was found to be pregnant during a preliminary test in jail, the deceased's brother said he would raise the child if Saurabh Rajput is identified as the father.

title: IPL LIVE: KKR Pacer Blasted By Experts As Marsh Runs Riot For 1-Down LSG
content: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Lucknow Super Giants LIVE Score, IPL 2025: Mitchell Marsh is comfortably dealing in boundaries and inching closer towards his century

title: Kunal Kamra vs BookMyShow: Inside The Delisting Controversy
content: Comedian Kunal Kamra has become the focus of a fresh controversy following reports that his shows were removed from the ticketing platform BookMyShow.

title: Couple Flees Sweden Eco-Retreat, Leaves Behind 158 Barrels Of Human Waste
content: A Danish chef couple, known for their environment-friendly retreat Stedsans, has reportedly fled to Guatemala amid a probe by tax authorities.

title: No Longer Extinct: Dire Wolves Howl Again After 12,000 Years
content: Billionaire Elon Musk reacted to the news, posting his own Wishlist. "Please make a miniature pet wooly mammoth," Musk posted on X, while resharing his own post.

title: Opinion: Will Waqf Bill Be India's New 'Shah Bano' Moment?
content: The Muslim community in India, despite finding its political power diminished today, has shown remarkable patience so far, choosing to lie low and avoid provocation. But the discontent over the Waqf bill threatens to undo this fragile understanding.

title: Rohit 'Impact Sub' Debate: Tempers Flare As Rayudu, Bangar Clash On TV
content: Rohit Sharma has been used as an Impact Substitute by Mumbai Indians since the start of IPL 2025, coming onto the field only to bat.

title: Global Temperatures At Historic Highs, Europe Records Hottest March Ever
content: Global temperatures hovered at historic highs in March, Europe's climate monitor said on Tuesday, prolonging an unprecedented heat streak that has pushed the bounds of scientific explanation.

title: BJP Suspends Leader Who 'Purified' Temple After Dalit Congress MLA's Visit
content: The BJP leadership in Rajasthan has suspended controversial leader Gyandev Ahuja from the party and issued a show cause notice, after he sprinkled 'gangajal' at a temple to 'purify' the premises after Congress' leader Tikaram Jully, a Dalit, visited

title: Why Some Cats Trigger Allergies More Than Others
content: Allergies can be debilitating for those who have them - even more so when the cause of the allergic reaction is a beloved pet.

title: What are the 10 Bills of Tamil Nadu withheld by Governor R.N. Ravi, now considered assented to after Supreme Court verdict?
content: Originally 12 Bills of Tamil Nadu, mostly dealing with appointments of Vice-Chancellors in state-run universities, were sent by the State Legislature for consent to the Governor between January 2020 and April 2023. The Governor sat on them indefinitely.

title: Palliative care training programme for healthcare professionals in 14 States launched
content: Participants will learn to manage complex symptoms in palliative care and will in turn mentor their peers and medical students; the project is an initiative of Pallium India and the Singapore International Foundation

title: Kerala Ministers, leaders hail Supreme Court verdict against TN Governor
content: Kerala Ministers and LDF leaders say apex court's verdict is a blow in the face of the Centre, which allegedly tries to use Governors as their tools

title: Stalin hails SC verdict on Tamil Nadu Governor’s assent to Bills as ‘historic’
content: The Supreme Court came down heavily on Mr. Ravi and said reservation of 10 Bills by him for consideration of the President was in contravention of constitutional provisions

title: Five big controversial actions of Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi
content: On April 8, 2025, the Supreme Court invoked powers to declare as many as 10 Bills on which he had delayed action, effectively approved

title: Bengaluru molestation: My words distorted, regret any pain to women, says Karnataka Minister Parameshwara
content: Karnataka Home Minister’s statement that ‘incidents like this do take place here and there’ had created a controversy, eliciting a strong criticism from Opposition BJP and the NCW

title: Heroin seized from government office in Arunachal, one employee held
content: The man is currently employed as a multi-tasking staff (MTS) in the State horticulture department, police said, adding the total market value of the seized heroin is estimated to be around ₹3.7 lakh

title: T.N. Assembly: AIADMK legislators stage walkout over Speaker’s denial of permission to raise issues
content: As a mark of protest against the denial of permission to raise issues, the AIADMK legislators participated in the Question Hour wearing black

title: Security heightened in Manipur's Lilong, Imphal East after violent protests over Waqf Act
content: Security forces equipped with anti-riot gear deployed in Manipur’s Thoubal district amid protests against Waqf Amendment Act

title: TASMAC versus ED case: Why are you insulting Madras High Court, Justice Subramaniam asks T.N. govt.
content: He also asks whether the government has filed the case to protect the public interest or the interests of a few TASMAC officials

title: Karnataka 2nd PUC results 2025 announced, pass percentage sees a dip compared to last year
content: Officials used Artificial Intelligence (AI) enabled CCTV cameras in the examination hall and webcasting of the entire process to check malpractices

title: T.N. Minister Senthilbalaji responds to ED’s allegations in cash-for-jobs scam case
content: In his affidavit, Mr. Senthilbhalaji responded that he was not prohibited from being a Minister by the Supreme Court in its bail order

title: Amit Shah chairs meeting to review developmental projects in Jammu and Kashmir
content: During the meeting, the officers will brief the Home Minister on the ongoing developmental projects in the Union Territory

title: Noted folk dancer Ram Sahay Panday dies; CM Yadav expresses grief
content: Renowned folk artist Ram Sahay Panday, Padma Shri recipient, passes away at 92 in Madhya Pradesh, leaving a legacy

title: Sambhal violence: SP MP Zia Barq appears before SIT to record statement
content: Samajwadi Party MP Zia Barq, questioned in connection with Sambhal violence, denies the allegations and cooperates with police

title: After SC verdict against T.N. Governor, Kerala urges CJI to list petition against delay in clearing bills
content: CJI listed the case on May 13, possibly before another Bench. The CJI did not specify that it would be before J. Pardiwala despite repeated entreaties made by Mr. Venugopal

title: India overhauls teaching in Himalayan Buddhist monasteries to counter China
content: About 600 monasteries scattered across the northern states of Sikkim, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, and the regions of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh offer training in four types of Tibetan and Indian Buddhist tradition

title: Congress will continue to fight democratically for people’s rights, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress-led standing committees made several suggestions to improve lives of Indians, says Rahul Gandhi

title: Courts not supposed to do moral policing: Supreme Court sets aside HC order against Tehseen Poonawalla
content: Supreme Court overturns High Court order imposing ₹10 fine on Tehseen Poonawalla for mocking Jain monk Tarun Sagar

title: Bengal’s aggrieved teachers upset over offer for ‘voluntary service’
content: They cite lack of clarity over whether their jobs would be terminated and if they would receive salaries for volunteering

title: Supreme Court prescribes time limits for Governors to act on Bills
content: This decision came after the top court came down heavily on Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi and said reservation of 10 Bills by him for consideration of the President was ‘erroneous in law’

title: Two killed, three injured in collision between jeep, parcel truck in Kerala’s Kottayam
content: Accident took place when driver lost control of jeep while negotiating a slanting stretch of road and hit the truck

title: ED raids in Karnataka over alleged financial irregularities in Shivamogga District Central Cooperative Bank
content: The raids were reportedly in connection with the disbursal of a loan of over ₹62 crore against fake gold jewellery by Shivamogga District Central Cooperative Bank

title: Wayanad landslides: NGT warns of summoning Kerala Chief Secretary over failure to file reports
content: Southern Bench of NGT, which took suo motu notice of a report on disaster published in The Hindu, expresses displeasure over response of authorities while pointing out that Kerala State Disaster Management Authority has not yet filed its report

title: 900 Kia car engines stolen in Andhra over five years, police launch probe
content: Police are suspecting that the massive theft is an ‘inside job’, prompting them to direct their probe towards the past and current employees of the car manufacturer

title: Maharashtra departments told to ensure 'no rush of expenditure' in last month of FY25
content: Maharashtra Finance Ministry urges departments to spend 60% of budget by December 2025 to avoid reductions in provisions

title: Karnataka sees rise in road accidents caused by minors, 751 cases reported in a year
content: The figures, compiled from the Integrated Road Accident Database (iRAD), place Tamil Nadu at the top with 2,063 such cases, followed by Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra

title: SC sets aside Calcutta HC order for CBI probe into creation of supernumerary posts by Bengal Cabinet
content: Top court made it clear the CBI probe as directed by the Calcutta HC into other aspects related to the appointment of 25,753 teachers and staffers in West Bengal’s State-run and aided school would continue

title: Kerala CPI(M) MP Radhakrishnan appears before ED in Karuvannur bank scam case
content: The ED case is that Karuvannur Service Co-operative Bank had illegally issued loans to different persons, violating the rules and procedures, and thus incurring a huge loss

title: Watch: Do schools in north India teach southern languages? | Data Point
content: The Hindu data team analyses the 2009 All India School Education Survey, which was accessed through sources in the Education Ministry

title: Idukki Collector to address complaints through Facebook
content: Every Wednesday from 6 p.m. to 7 p.m., she would respond to the grievances posted by the people on her official Facebook page

title: Kunal Kamra case: Bombay High Court seeks response from Maharashtra Government on Kamra’s petition to quash FIR
content: The court kept the matter for detailed hearing on April 16; Mumbai Police have summoned Mr. Kamra thrice for his alleged remarks on Maharashtra’s Deputy CM Eknath Shinde

title: Pawan Kalyan’s son injured in fire accident in Singapore
content: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan cancels Vizag schedule, but goes to a tribal hamlet before leaving for Singapore to meet his son, who was injured in a fire accident.

title: Rajasthan Congress leader runs SUV over pedestrians in Jaipur, three dead
content: As the vehicle moved from MI road to the narrow lanes under the Nahargarh police station area, the drunk factory owner mowed down people and vehicles on it way

title: Day after Congress’ Tikaram Jully attended consecration, BJP leader ‘purifies’ Rajasthan temple
content: Congress leaders have termed BJP leader Gyan Dev Ahuja’s act an insult to a Dalit but he denied the charge

title: Mudra Yojana is an eye-opener for any government, says PM Modi
content: April 8 India marks 10 years of the Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana, the Flagship Programme of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, aimed at funding the Unfunded micro enterprises and small businesses.

title: Blast outside BJP leader Manoranjan Kalia's house in Jalandhar; two held, ISI involved, say police
content: Police are investigating the incident that took place at the home of the former Punjab Cabinet minister

title: Two militants arrested in Manipur's Imphal East
content: A huge cache of arms and ammunition was also recovered during search operations in Churachandpur,  Kangpokpi and Imphal East

title: Software engineer found dead in apartment in Bengaluru
content: Recently, he had separated from his wife, who was living in a different house along with their daughter

title: Joyride turns fatal: Two killed, seven injured as SUV collides with goods carrier
content: Due to the impact of the collision, both the vehicles were mangled, killing the two on the spot. Others with critical injuries are currently undergoing treatment.

title: Heatwaves drove 1/3rd of rise in India's power demand during 2024 summer: Report
content: During the peak heatwave months from April to June, the demand was 10.8% higher than the previous year

title: A case for a fair seat allocation
content: Article 1 of the Constitution proclaims that India shall be a Union of States. The term Union implies that the arrangement or rearrangement of the component units should be on the basis of equity. There are serious apprehensions in the south on the question of readjustment of seats in the Lok Sabha

title: Children undergoing cancer treatment in Mumbai and Chennai get chess coaching classes
content: For children undergoing cancer treatment, chess can help prevent potential cognitive decline and promote emotional resilience during their cancer treatment.

title: Jalgaon authorities cancel 43 forged birth and death document orders
content: On February 21, 2025, a person suddenly submitted a total of 50 birth and death document orders of the Tehsildar to the Birth and Death Department of the Municipal Corporation but when it was scrutinised, it was found that the signature on the order was forged.

title: Pune woman’s death: probe panel finds hospital guilty of denying immediate treatment
content: A state-appointed probe committee has found Deenanath Mangeshkar Hospital in Pune in violation of emergency care norms after it allegedly denied admission to a pregnant woman, Tanisha Bhise, said the hospital failed to comply with the Bombay Public Trust Act

title: Farmers leave tomatoes in fields as price drops to ₹2 a kg
content: The farmers said the selling price of one box (15 kg) of tomatoes is anywhere between ₹30 to ₹200 (₹2 per kg to ₹13 per kg) at the Kolar Agricultural Produce Market Committee

title: Plea in SC accuses MNS chief Raj Thackeray of hate speech, Maharashtra govt. of inaction
content: Sunil Shukla, the national president of Uttar Bhartiya Vikas Sena, said his advocacy for the rights of north Indians had made him a target for harassment and physical intimidation by MNS and its affiliated groups

title: CBI arrests two Railway officials on graft charge
content: Subsequent searches led to the seizure of about ₹63.85 lakh in cash, gold bars and ornaments worth close to ₹3.46 crore.

title: Opposition targets CM Mamata Banerjee over 25,000 job losses
content: Protests by BJP leaders also led to the arrests of multiple protesters including senior leader Locket Chatterjee

title: Obesity to anxiety, report flags rising tide of lifestyle diseases in Telangana
content: Apollo Hospitals’ HoN-2025 report reveals alarming trends in lifestyle diseases, urging immediate action to combat rising health risks

title: Intermediate education needs corrective interventions, says  Telangana gazetted junior lecturers’ association
content: As of 2025, the State has 424 government junior colleges for both general and vocational streams and nearly 1.43 lakh students

title: Telangana poised to emerge as hub for highly skilled HR: Minister Sridhar Babu
content: The government is committed to equipping the youth of Telangana with top-tier skills to align with the evolving needs of various industries, Mr.Sridhar Babu said

title: ‘Turned away’ by two private hospital in Gurugram, techie dies of accident injuries
content: Shomita Singh a 28-year-old software engineer and part of a women riders’ group, was hit by a sedan coming from the front in Badshahpur on Sunday

title: Aqua farmers to constitute National Prawn Coordination Committee
content: Farmers, traders to promote nutritional values of shrimp, fish and take measures to increase domestic consumption, says Minister Atchannaidu

title: Jaishankar, Rubio pitch for early conclusion of the Bilateral Trade Agreement
content: In first call since U.S. imposed tariffs, the External Affairs Minister and the U.S. Secretary of State discuss trade and regional issues

title: 'Winning time': Florida rallies once again for title
content: Florida rallied from a 12-point deficit to survive a defensive slugfest vs. Houston and earn the program its third national championship since 2006.

title: Houston stunned: 'That broke everybody's heart'
content: Houston squandered a 12-point lead in the second half and finished the national title game with four consecutive turnovers in losing to Florida on Monday night.

title: House settlement inches closer to final approval
content: A judge directed lawyers to address a short list of her remaining concerns about a multibillion-dollar settlement that could reshape college sports.

title: Ohtani falls double shy of cycle in Dodgers' loss
content: Los Angeles star Shohei Ohtani, a three-time MVP, fell a double short of hitting for the cycle Monday night, as the Dodgers dropped a 6-4 decision to the Washington Nationals, a nice bounce-back for the DH after he went 1-for-11 over the weekend.

title: Jenkins sues NCAA for limiting pay while at Nova
content: Through a lawsuit filed last week in New York, former NCAA tournament hero Kris Jenkins is suing the NCAA and six conferences for limiting athlete pay and restricting his ability to capitalize off his name, image and likeness while he was at Villanova.

title: Sources: Miami has discovery rights for De Bruyne
content: Inter Miami CF hold the discovery rights for Manchester City player Kevin De Bruyne, sources have told ESPN, setting up a scenario in which the Belgian playmaker could join Lionel Messi in south Florida.

title: Man admits to selling $250K in fake memorabilia
content: A former California resident pleaded guilty to selling hundreds of thousands of dollars in fake memorabilia.

title: 'A big swing-and-miss': Has Deshaun Watson played his last down in the NFL?

title: Leicester lose record 8th in a row without scoring

title: MLS Power Rankings: Messi's Miami stay No. 1, Columbus hold on to No. 2 spot

title: Lil Wayne visits Bill Belichick in Chapel Hill, receives UNC football jersey
content: With spring practices in full swing around the country, the  North Carolina Tar Heels  welcomed a visitor with some serious star power over the weekend -- Lil Wayne. The famed rapper visited the Tar Heels' football facilities Saturday in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, where he met head coach Bill Belichick, among others. Two Legends.  pic.twitter.com/7gWVhunTZN Lil Wayne received a custom North Carolina football jersey, with his nickname "Tunechi" and the No. 17, a nod to his roots in New Orleans' 17th Ward. Shhh...The Fireman Coming. 🔥  pic.twitter.com/Q4DLrYlMM1 Lil Wayne is a known  Green Bay Packers   superfan , but he has also expressed support for Belichick in his new position. When the longtime  New England Patriots  coach was  officially hired by  the Tar Heels in December, the artist congratulated Belichick  on social media  -- writing "Man much respect 2da GOAT coach." "Tha Carter VI," Lil Wayne's latest studio album, is slated for release in June.

title: Smith, Carroll have 'unfinished business' in Vegas
